entry.title: How to CAST a CHAR(12) field to CHAR(10) and use it in a JOIN inside Custom CDS Views S/4H CloudPubl
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôm working in SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, and I need to create a join between the following fields:

  • I_PurchaseOrderAPI01.PurchaseOrder (type CHAR(10))

  • I_PurchaseOrderAPI01.CorrespncExternalReference (type CHAR(12))

The issue is that the CorrespncExternalReference field contains the Purchase Order number plus two additional characters.
For example:

450000123456 ‚Üí the real PO number is 4500001234

What I need to do is join both fields using only the first 10 characters of CorrespncExternalReference,
like this:

I_PurchaseOrderAPI01.PurchaseOrder = substring(I_PurchaseOrderAPI01.CorrespncExternalReference, 1, 10)

OR MAY

I_PurchaseOrderAPI01.PurchaseOrder = cast(I_PurchaseOrderAPI01.CorrespncExternalReference as ebeln/char10)

I want to achieve this inside a Custom CDS View, because I‚Äôll later consume it in an Analytical Cube and bring both the Supplier and SupplierName for each Purchase Order.

However, I ran into some limitations:

  • In the Custom CDS Views app, I can‚Äôt use string functions like substring() in the join condition.

  • I also can‚Äôt cast a CHAR(12) to CHAR(10) directly.

  • I tried creating a calculated field (CorrespncExternalReferenceTrim) and then using it in the join, but the system doesn‚Äôt allow calculated fields in joins.

  • I also tried creating a CDS view in Eclipse with this annotations:

@AbapCatalog.viewEnhancementCategory: [#NONE]
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'Purchase Order'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
@ObjectModel.usageType:{
    serviceQuality: #X,
    sizeCategory: #S,
    dataClass: #MIXED
}
@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: [ #CDS_MODELING_DATA_SOURCE, #CDS_MODELING_ASSOCIATION_TARGET ]
//@ObjectModel.supportedCapabilities: #CDS_MODELING_ASSOCIATION_TARGET

but it doesn‚Äôt show up as a selectable data source inside Custom CDS Views. Only SAP standard views or those created directly within the app appears.

My questions are:

  1. Is there any way to perform this kind of join (substring or length-based) directly in Custom CDS Views?

  2. If not, what annotations should I add in Eclipse to make a custom CDS view visible as a data source inside Custom CDS Views?

  3. Are there specific restrictions in S/4HANA Cloud (Public Edition) that prevent using developer-created CDS views in Custom CDS Views?

Any example or best practice would be really appreciated üôè

Thanks in advance,

Luka!

entry.title: Rental process through solution order - how to manage returns
entry.content:
Hello!

We are using solution orders where we need to bundle different services offered to the customers. One of the requirements is to have rental items. In this scenario the business would send out an equipment as rent and then they would receive it back and bill their customer based on the usage.

Now in Solution order, I was able to create a sales order using item category 'Rental Item' which in turn created a sales order

 

 

We then delivered the item and saw that it shows up as customer stock:

Now, I have a very basic question - what is the right process to bring this back? I have explored the option of returns sales order, but I am hesitant to use it because Return orders are typically used when a customer wants to truly return an item (which was sold) for specific reasons and they expect some sort of compensation. 

Is there a leading practice for receiving back rental items followed by the billing to the customer based on the usage of the rental item?

 

Any help, insight would be highly appreciated.

 

Thanks

Snigdhodeep

entry.title: Project: Budget Availability Control: message has name of manager missing
entry.content:
Hi all,

I have set up budget availability control for projects. The system gives a warning when creating a purchase order as of 80% and an error as of 100%, which is as I set it up.

However, the message (FCO_AVC_PS002) that the system gives, doesn't insert the name of the project manager. You see that there is a space, so normally it should take it from the project master data. At that level I have filled it in, but it is not coming in this message.

Does anyone knows how to solve this?

entry.title: PO Fields Missing in Line Item¬†Reports
entry.content:
In SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition, the Purchase Order (PO) field in the Supplier Line Item Report appears empty when an invoice is posted.
However, the PO field appears correctly for advance payments.

The issue occurs under both conditions:

  • One Purchase Order against one Invoice

  • Multiple Purchase Orders against one Invoice


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

entry.content:

We added a custom field (YY1_CarrierTracking_HUH ) to the Handling Unit API (api_handlingunit).

But upon trying to do an update for this field via PATCH method, I am getting the following error: "State of entity CDS~A_HANDLINGUNIT_2 with key 00101809040000001420 1001 was already changed (stale If-Match)"

entry.title: Clarification on Total Limit and Utilization of Custom Fields Across Business Contexts
entry.content:
Dear SAP, 

 

I would like to get clarification on the following questions: 

  1. What is the total limit of Custom Fields available per Business Context?

  2. For the Business Contexts ‚ÄúSales Document‚Äù and ‚ÄúSales Document Item‚Äù, what exactly is the limit?

  3. Is the limit defined in KB/MB or by the number of characters? Please specify the exact storage capacity (e.g., how many KBs/MBs or characters can be stored).

  4. How is the limit utilization calculated or monitored for Custom Fields? For instance, how can we determine how much of the allowed capacity has already been consumed?

 

Can you help?

Thanks! 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Missing standard value in a custom user role
entry.content:
Hello experts, 
i have the following issue. I created  a user role for a finance user and now the user reports that he cant define a standard value for the "calculate tax" checkbox, which is used in apps like "create supplier invoice". 

In addition to the finance catalogs the role has the catalogs from the standard SAP-Role BR_EMPLOYEE, especially the catalog for the user standardvalues (SAP_CA_BC_USER_PARAM_PC).
My question is, what am i missing ? Is there a setting or app to control these standardvalues ? Or is it only depended on the business catalogs and if so, how can i find out which catalog im missing ?

Best regards
Lukas

entry.title: Operation for Deleting Business Roles
entry.content:
Currently, we are considering the operational procedures for deleting business roles in the production environment of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition. Therefore, I would like to ask for the opinions of those with expertise.

Please let me know the points to be careful about when deleting business users who have retired. At present, the only procedure we are considering is to confirm with the audit team whether there are any issues from an audit perspective, but please advise if there are other points that should be taken into account. In our current environment, we are only using SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition, without any side-by-side extensions, and only performing in-app extensions.

entry.title: KDM Transaction Key Not Triggering in Customizing System During MIRO Testing in S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Description:
Hello Experts,
In our SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud (3-system landscape) ‚Äì production system, we observed that during MIRO posting, the system creates a journal entry with the following lines:
‚Ä¢ Vendor ‚Äì Credit
‚Ä¢ GR/IR ‚Äì Debit
‚Ä¢ BSX (Material) ‚Äì Credit
‚Ä¢ KDM ‚Äì Credit
However, the G/L account assigned to KDM was maintained as a Balance Sheet account, which is incorrect.
We have corrected this in Automatic Account Determination by assigning a P&L G/L account for the KDM transaction key.
To validate this correction, we are trying to replicate the same MIRO posting in our customizing (test) tenant, but the system is not triggering the KDM line item.

‚Ä¢ Test Scenario in Customizing System:
‚Ä¢ Material with zero stock and price control = V (Moving Average)
‚Ä¢ Supplier currency: EUR
‚Ä¢ PO and GRN posted on 14th Oct with exchange rate (e.g. 1 EUR = X IQD)
‚Ä¢ MIRO posted on 15th Oct with a different exchange rate
‚Ä¢ Expected: KDM line to be triggered
‚Ä¢ Actual: No KDM line item generated in accounting entry

‚Ä¢ Our Objective:
We want to validate that the corrected P&L G/L account is being picked up for KDM before moving the configuration to production. Please suggest how can we trigger KDM key

entry.title: how to show up payment methods that we need , like cash or paycheque.
entry.content:
on our CBC, we can see only three payment methods: Foreign bank transfer, Electronic Monetary Claim,  and domestic transfer. but we need to assign payment methods like cash or pay cheque.

do we miss some configuration or do we need to add some payment methods ?

entry.title: Delivery date in Purchase request
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I've noticed that in Purchase Orders, the delivery date is based on the Planned Delivery Time, but in Purchase Requisitions, it's calculated as Planned Delivery Time plus 3 days. I couldn‚Äôt find where this extra time is maintained.

Also, the GR Processing Time doesn‚Äôt seem to affect the delivery date in either PR or PO. Can someone clarify where this time is actually considered?

Best regards 

Dinesh

entry.title: Clarification on MRP Behaviour for Split Procurement Between Supplying Plant and External Vendor
entry.content:
Dear Support Team,

We have a coming demo for a customer which they particularly asked for few scenarios. I would like to seek clarification on the one of the MRP scenario involving two plants.

Scenario:

  • Plant A ‚Äì Requirement is created through a weekly PIR for a raw material.

  • Plant B ‚Äì Acts as the supplying plant with no demand of its own but has stock available to supply Plant A.

  • In Plant A, the material master is maintained with a Special Procurement Key to source from Plant B.

Expectation:

  1. When MRP runs in Plant A, it should create a Stock Transport Requisition (STO) from Plant B to cover the PIR demand.

  2. Later, if Plant B does not have enough stock available, and the PIR quantity in Plant A is increased, the next MRP run in Plant A should:

    • Create an STO for the quantity available in Plant B, and

    • Create an external Purchase Requisition for the remaining shortage, which Plant B cannot fulfil.

Question:
Does MRP in Plant A check the stock availability in Plant B before generating procurement proposals? If Plant B only has partial stock, can the system automatically generate an STO for the available quantity and an external PR for the remaining requirement within the same MRP run? Or will it continue to create only the STO as per the special procurement setup?

I understand that a possible workaround could be to use Quota Management to manage multiple sources of supply. However, this option is not feasible in this case, as the customer does not wish to use quota arrangements for this scenario.

Please confirm if the expected split procurement behaviour is supported in standard SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, or if an enhancement or specific configuration is required to achieve it.

Best regards,
Vindhya

entry.title: SAP Public Cloud 2508 / Question on the implementation of BADI MRM_WORKFLOW_AGENTS with custom field
entry.content:
Hello experts,
im currently working on an implementation for the "Flexible workflow for parked invoice as complete". In this context i wanted to use  the BADI "MRM_WORKFLOW_AGENTS" to create a custom determination of the approvers in this workflow. 

My question is, is there a way to add additional parameters, that can be imported and used for this BADI Implementation ?
I especially wanted to use a custom field, that i created for supplier invoices, in this BADI code and determine the approver based on its value.

Best regards 
Lukas

entry.title: IAM Apps tab missing in Maintain Business Roles app after transport to QAS (S/4HANA Cloud Public Edi
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are currently using SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition and have two tenants: DEV and QAS.

On the DEV system, we created a custom Business Role via the Maintain Business Roles app.
The role includes IAM-related catalogs, and everything displays correctly ‚Äî especially the IAM Apps tab within the role details screen.

However, after transporting the same role to the QAS system, the IAM Apps tab is completely missing from the Maintain Business Roles UI.
Other tabs (like Business Catalogs, Restrictions, etc.) appear as usual.

I‚Äôve confirmed that:

  • The business catalog assignments are identical in both systems.

  • My user has SAP_BR_ADMINISTRATOR and other required authorizations.

  • The role object was transported successfully without error.

Has anyone experienced this behavior before?
Is there a specific configuration or authorization required to make the IAM Apps tab visible in QAS as well?

Any advice or SAP Note reference would be appreciated üôè

Thanks in advance
